intro: Congea barbata, commonly known as the hairy congea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
